file_content.text: You have more than justified my faith in you.
Gentlemen, ladies. This is the woman I've been telling you about. Who destroyed Grand Admiral Harridax Kirill and saved our shipyards.
Gentlemen, ladies. This is the man I told you about. Who destroyed Grand Admiral Harridax Kirill and saved our shipyards.
My son is an engineer at those shipyards. You saved his life.
Captain, this is Senator Rone, Fleet Admiral Helik, Supreme Commander Rans. Of course, you recognize the Supreme Chancellor.
They've come to thank you for dispersing the Voidwolf's fleet.
It wasn't some grand gesture. Don't start making speeches.
I didn't do it for you.
Whatever your personal goals, Captain, you've saved our shipyards and bought us time to regroup against the Empire.
They've come to thank you for turning the Voidwolf's fleet against the Empire.
Can I get that in writing? Just in case, you know, I'm ever on the Republic's bad list again....
That sounds handy.
I think they have something even better....
You're welcome.
The war's not over yet. Why are we standing around gabbing?
I don't have time for this.
It may not be over, Captain, but you've bought us the time to catch our breath.
Neither the Republic nor the Empire will forget this day. You have set your name on galactic history.
Captain, I am pleased to present you with the Senatorial Medal of Service.
That's the highest civilian award the Republic issues. You have changed the tide of this war.
It's been fun working for the Republic. Or thinking I was. And then really... you know what I mean.
I like this privateer thing.
A Jedi and a Republic hero... stranger things have happened, right?
[Flirt] I'm a hero now.
You had to go there....
Why and how we all came to be here now tops my personal list of "stranger things."
Nice award.
Your service has been truly priceless.
Really, I don't deserve it.
Uh, no thanks.
Is that guilt I hear? Take the award, Captain. Maybe it will become more meaningful to you in the future.
Is there much market for that sort of award?
How much is that thing worth?
This is a priceless honor!
The captain's just trying to get a rise out of you. I don't think you're running short on credits, Captain.
You seem to have a talent for this. Would you give some thought to continuing as a privateer? Under my guidance.
You pick the target; I keep any incidental profits made along the way?
Same terms?
Within limits.
I can't think of anything I'd rather do.
Of course.
You're a rare find, Captain.
I've never worked under a Jedi before.
[Flirt] Of course.
You are incorrigible!
This will offer many new experiences for both of us.
You got something in mind?
Do you have a mission?
I'm sure I will soon.
I'll be in touch with the details.
It seems there are times when it's an advantage to have an operative who isn't bound by the rule of law.
I never thought I'd see you on the Jedi Order's payroll, Captain.
Where to now?
Does the Republic think they have bought your loyalty with stamped silver on a ribbon?
Only you could manage to turn taking over the underworld into a good citizenship award!
I'll get Port Nowhere back up and running, Captain. You're going to need a base of operations... and someone at the wheel you can trust.
No offense, but you're better at finding credits than keeping them. Even my father needed a broker for his empire.
Gives you time to do the fun part!
Mission accomplished. Shariss is safe.
I admit, I was wondering what to think of Senator Dodonna's pet project.
But you saved a life here and aided the war. I can say nothing but "thank you."
Not, "But I have another job for you...?" Because I get that a lot.
Is there anything more?
Nothing now. Although I'll keep the offer in mind.
You're welcome.
You are a rare find, Captain. I hope you continue serving the Republic.
I've never shaken hands with a real Jedi before. Are you nearby?
[Flirt] Thank me in person.
Don't even start.
Even if I hadn't renounced worldly pleasures, I know far better than to come between Risha and any man she's eyeing.
He wishes!
If there's nothing more, I have places to be.
Are we done?
Of course.
Perhaps we'll catch up again some time, Risha.
Not sure my current occupation will bring me anywhere near the Jedi Temple. But maybe.
I hope this war ends swiftly enough that I will not have cause to call on you again.
Set course for Voss, then, Captain? The permits from Dodonna just came through.
If it gets me closer to Rogun's head on a plate, Voss it is.
Full speed ahead.
Voss... Voss... That rings a bell, but...
Remind me where that is?
Our next stop, genius. Home of Rogun's cyber-attack-dogs?
Dodonna can wait. I've got a whole galaxy to explore.
I've got things to do first.
Don't wait too long. I think the permits have an expiry date. Voss is a little... controlling.
I took the liberty of looking into the place. Weird planet. Just made contact with the rest of the galaxy after a Sith ship crashed there.
Apparently the whole planet's on the leash to some cult of Force-users. Empire and Republic are both playing along.
This'll be one to wear your best shirt and remember to say "please."
Yeah? What's your distress? Talk to me.
How refreshing... the whole, "I'm honored to serve you, revered Master" does get tiresome.
Master Sumalee. I've been following your career. I hear you have a special interest in the Voidwolf.
I'm mostly interested in staying as far away as this scrap heap can fly me.
Only in avoiding him.
Unlikely. From our surveillance, he seems to have made you a particular target.
Is there something I should know?
What about him?
I was hoping you might want to hurt him. And save a life while you're at it.
And here I thought when you joined the temple, you were done chasing street scum. Welcome back.
We're at war. We all serve how we know best.
I've got a bad track record with false Jedi.
Why should I trust you?
I told you I was sorry. What do you want, flowers?
Then it's good you're traveling with someone who can vouch for me. Ironic as that may be.
Nice to see you again, Sumalee. Just don't expect me to call you "Master."
All right, let's pretend I trust you. Why are you calling me?
What do you want?
I've got room on the ship if you guys want to... catch up on old times.
[Flirt] You two seem friendly.
Do you do this just to annoy me? Or is that a bonus?
Excuse him. I've tried to have him fixed, but I can't find a vet who'll do the job.
Becoming a prude in your old age?
You two feel free to catch up. I've got work to do.
I don't have time for this.
Hear me out, Captain. Please.
It sounds like there's a story here.
You know her?
Not one you're going to hear. She is who she says. Let's leave it at that.
We're not born to the robes, Captain. The Force sometimes picks unlikely candidates.
Risha, do you remember Shariss Kartur?
What did they used to call us? "The triple threat..." Didn't she join the SIS?
One of their top agents. When you took out the White Maw's cloaking abilities on Hoth, it drew the Voidwolf's attention. He went there... and Shariss followed.
Alone? Is she crazy?
The Republic sent an entire platoon of troopers to escort her. The Voidwolf's assassins killed them all. She is alive but trapped on Hoth.
Are you asking me to help out of the goodness of my heart, or is there something on the table?
So this is a charity case?
The SIS is offering a sizeable reward. Or they will once I tell them they are.
Is there a special "guilt" power in the Force? Jedi always make me feel like I'm talking to my mom.
Stop the sad story, I'll help!
The sign of a heavy conscience.
Before you ask, I've got no plans to go back to Hoth any time soon.
I'm busy.
So change your blasted plans!
When I got Shariss's distress call, she had taken refuge in one of the Voidwolf's private vaults.
Identify yourself by the password: "Kavaa kyotopa bu whirlee backa." She'll respond with "Smeeleya whao tupee upee," then pass you a key.
Uh... "Kava... hoopty whoopty do." Got it.
I won't remember that.
Kavaa kyotopa bu whirlee backa. I know you speak Huttese.
Show-off.
If you hear from her again, tell her help is coming and--ah, not to break anything in that vault.
I'm on my way.
I doubt she will risk calling.
Sounds easier than fighting with Risha for the next six months.
Fine. I'll help.
Bet your ship it is!
Go quickly if you can. I fear you're Shariss's last hope.
